Incident.Summary: The victim and suspect were involved in a road rage incident. The suspect damaged the victim's vehicle and left the scene.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
In car camera (N-12) and MSP issued body worn camera fully functional.

Scene Processing:

   During the course of the investigation, I took multiple digital photographs of the damage to the victim’s vehicle, obtained one written statement from the victim.  The suspect was located and was subsequently charged on Uniform Criminal Citation (222001040306) for Malicious Destruction of Property: Less than $1000.

Physical Evidence:
  1. Seven (7) digital photographs documenting the damage to the victim’s vehicle, and showing the suspect at the scene.
Attachments:
  1. Seven (7) digital photographs.
  2. One written statement from the victim.
  3. One Criminal Citation (222001040306)
Narrative:

  On 02/02/2023 at approximately 1630 hours, I (TFC J. Reid #7215) responded to 19924 Sweetgum Cir, Germantown, MD 20874 and made contact with the complainant who I was able to positively identify by her MVA photograph as, Mo’Nasha Keioney Edwards (B/F DOB: 07/29/1996). Edwards advised on her way home from work she was involved in a road rage incident with another driver.  Edwards stated the other driver damaged the back of her vehicle.  Edwards stated she had just merged onto the inner loop of I-495 from Cabin John Pkwy and was in lane 4.  Edwards stated another vehicle, which was already on I-495 in lane 3, was trying to merge from lane 3 into lane 4. Edwards advised she was not able to let the vehicle over due to heavy traffic at the time. Edwards stated the other vehicle merged into lane 4 anyway, nearly striking the front of her car.  Edwards stated the vehicle began brake checking her. Edwards stated she was able to merge into lane 3, pass the vehicle, and then merge back into lane 4 directly in front of the vehicle.  Edwards stated the driver of the other vehicle became agitated and began tailgating her and sticking his middle finger up at her.  Edwards stated she pulled over onto the right shoulder in an attempt to let the other vehicle pass and avoid any other confrontations, however, the vehicle pulled over onto the right shoulder directly behind her.  Edwards stated the driver then exited his vehicle, approached her vehicle on the driver’s side. Edwards stated she opened her driver’s door and asked the driver of the other vehicle, “what’s your problem”.  Edwards advised the other driver started yelling, “You’re my problem! You’re scum!”  Edwards stated she exited the vehicle and continued to argue with the other driver.  Edwards stated the other driver then returned to his vehicle and appeared to be grabbing something from inside his vehicle.  Fearing the other driver may be grabbing a weapon or some other object, Edwards stated she got back into her car and locked the doors. Edwards stated the other driver got back out of his vehicle and threw something at the rear of her vehicle. Edwards stated she heard a loud impact at the rear of her vehicle.  Edwards advised she did not see what the other driver threw.  Edwards advised she “did not think anything of it”.  Edwards advised the other driver then got back into his vehicle and drove away.  Edwards admitted to throwing water from a water bottle at the vehicle as it was driving away.  Edwards agreed to complete a written statement which is attached to this report.  Edwards provided me with the digital photographs she took of the suspect and the vehicle. Edwards did not make any other statements regarding the incident.

   I inspected Edwards’ vehicle and observed her vehicle to be a gray Mazda SUV bearing Maryland registration “8EV5873”. I observed the vehicle to have large hole approximately the size of a baseball on the trunk of the vehicle right above the license plate.  I did not observe any other damage to the vehicle.  I took multiple digital photographs of the damage to Edwards’ vehicle, documenting the damage.
   I was able to obtain the registration plate information of the suspect vehicle from the photographs Edward provided.  I observed the suspect vehicle to be a silver Subaru passenger car bearing Maryland registration, “2BR5172”.  I ran a check of the registration through the MVA which revealed the registered owner lives at, 19307 Club House Rd Apt 304, Montgomery Village, Maryland 20886.  While en-route to that address, I was advised by my supervisor over the phone that he was able to get in contact with the registered owner of the suspect vehicle.  My supervisor stated the registered owner was with the suspect who was driving the vehicle at the time of the incident.  Upon my arrival to the suspect's address, I made contact with the registered owner of the vehicle, and the suspect who I was able to positively identify by the photograph on his Maryland driver's license as, Austen Turner Gray (W/M DOB: 01/08/1990).  Gray stated he was driving on the inner loop of I-495 in the area of Cabin John Pkwy in lane 3. Gray stated after making a lane change from lane 3 into lane 4, a gray Mazda SUV (Edwards) passed him and another vehicle on the right shoulder as he was merging. Gray stated it was his belief the other driver thought he cut them off.  Gray stated the driver of that vehicle became visibly agitated and began throwing various objects at his vehicle.  Gray stated the vehicle then pulled directly in front of him and began brake checking him. Gray stated he slowed down in attempt to let the Mazda SUV get ahead of him to avoid any other conflicts, however, the gray Mazda did not drive away. Gray stated he then pulled onto the right shoulder in an attempt to let the gray Mazda drive away, however, the gray Mazda pulled over onto the right shoulder directly in front of him.  Gray advised the driver of the Mazda then exited her vehicle, and continued to throw objects at his vehicle. Gray stated he then drove away from the Mazda, however, the Mazda continued to follow him all the way into Rockville at which time the vehicle stopped following him.  Gray denied damaging Edwards' vehicle and refused to provide a written statement about the events.  Gray made no further statements about the incident.

   Gray was charged with Malicious Destruction of Property: Less than $1000 via Uniform Criminal Citation (222001040306) and released.  

   Edwards was advised via email to provide me with an estimate for the total cost of the damage, however, she did not respond to my email. 

   All events occurred in Montgomery County, Maryland.

   Case closed via Criminal Citation.
